title: GSDNet: Revisiting Incomplete Multimodal-Diffusion from Graph Spectrum Perspective for Conversation Emotion Recognition
author: Yuntao Shou (College of Computer and Mathematics, Central South University of Forestry and Technology), Jun Yao (Department of Computer Science, Anhui Normal University), Tao Meng (College of Computer and Mathematics, Central South University of Forestry and Technology), Wei Ai (College of Computer and Mathematics, Central South University of Forestry and Technology), Cen Chen (Future Technology Institute, South China University of Technology), Keqin Li (Department of Computer Science, State University of New York), ...
relevance_why: The paper tackles multimodal emotion recognition, which is relevant to audio and speech analysis as it explores integrating different modalities, including audio, for emotion detection.
background: The task involves recognizing emotions during conversations by analyzing information from various modalities, such as audio, video, and text, even when some of these modalities are missing.
contribution: GSDNet introduces a graph spectral diffusion model where Gaussian noise is confined to the graph's spectral space to recover missing modalities effectively, achieving improved emotion recognition performance.
technical_comparison: Previous methods rely on direct noise addition to adjacency matrices, risking the loss of semantic structure. This work improves by limiting noise diffusion to the spectral space of the graph, preserving topological information.
key_innovation: The integration of spectral analysis with diffusion models for effective modality recovery while maintaining graph topology is a unique approach in the realm of emotion recognition.
real_world_impact: By enhancing the robustness of emotion recognition systems in real-world scenarios with missing modalities, GSDNet holds potential for applications in human-computer interaction, mental health analysis, and customer service.
limitations: The paper does not mention specific limitations.

new_terms.Graph Spectral Diffusion: **Graph Spectral Diffusion** refers to a technique that confines noise diffusion to the spectral components of a graph's adjacency matrix to preserve its topological characteristics during the recovery of missing modalities.
